events.message: Customer reported a rear-end collision involving their vehicle at a traffic light junction causing moderate damage.
The claim was evaluated and categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report submitted by the claimant.
An insurance agent was assigned to this case to assist the customer throughout the claims process and act as liaison.
Customer received formal confirmation that their auto accident claim was acknowledged by the insurance company.
Requested the customer to provide photos of the vehicle damage, police accident report, and proof of insurance coverage.
Customer promptly submitted all requested documents including accident scene photos and official police report.
Claim investigation was initiated by the assigned agent to verify the details of the accident and assess liability.
Investigation concluded determining the opposing driver was at fault based on evidence and witness statements.
Insurance company proposed a settlement offer covering repairs and rental car expenses for the claimant.
The customer expressed satisfaction over the fair settlement proposal and appreciative of the agent's support.
The insurance claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was disbursed to the customerâ€™s account to facilitate vehicle repairs.
The claim case was officially closed after confirmation that repairs were completed and the customer was fully reimbursed.
